<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	U.S. government backed securities, corporate bonds, and commercial paper are valued using a market
	approach based upon the quoted market prices of identical instruments when available or other observable inputs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-16
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D264994D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	such as trading prices of identical instruments in inactive markets or similar securities. The interest rate swap derivative is valued using observable inputs at the reporting date. It is the
	Company&#146;s policy to recognize transfers between levels of the fair value hierarchy, if any, at the end of the reporting period however there have been no such transfers during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Contingent consideration is recorded at fair value as an element of purchase price with subsequent adjustments recognized in the
	consolidated statement of operations. At the acquisition date and reporting date, the fair value of the accrued contingent consideration was determined using a probability-weighted income approach based on upside, downside and base case scenarios.
	This approach is based on significant inputs that are not observable in the market, which are referred to as Level 3 inputs. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, the Company has accrued a liability of $8.2&nbsp;million and $4.7&nbsp;million,
	respectively, for the estimated fair value of contingent considerations estimated to be payable upon the acquired company reaching specific performance metrics over a specific period of operations after acquisition. The elements that make up the
	contingent consideration are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Anodyne
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The first potential contingent consideration related to our acquisition of Anodyne Health Partners, Inc. (&#147;Anodyne&#148;) in 2009 ranges from zero to $4.8&nbsp;million and is payable in one
	installment based upon operational performance for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010. Based on the actual operational performance for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, the Company had accrued $2.4&nbsp;million relating to the first
	potential contingent consideration which was paid in full in March of 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The second potential contingent related to our
	acquisition of Anodyne in 2009 ranges from zero to $2.9&nbsp;million and is payable in quarterly installments based upon the cross selling of the Company&#146;s services into the acquired company&#146;s customer base or customer leads for the years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2011, and the six-month period ending June&nbsp;30, 2012. Any amounts not earned in the first potential contingent consideration can be earned under the second potential contingent consideration in excess of the
	initial $2.9&nbsp;million bringing the total potential contingent consideration to $5.3&nbsp;million. At December&nbsp;31, 2011, the Company valued the second contingent consideration at $1.4 million. At December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, key
	assumptions relating to the second potential contingent consideration include earn-out payments, a probability adjusted level of 50% for the base case scenario and 25% for the upside and downside scenarios. A refinement in the estimated earn-out
	payment assumptions by scenario resulted in an insignificant decrease in the fair value of the total contingent consideration during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011. The Company paid $955 and $195 during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011
	and 2010, respectively under the terms of the second potential contingent consideration. No amounts were paid in 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Proxsys
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The first potential contingent consideration related to our acquisition of Proxsys in 2011 ranges from zero to
	$3.0&nbsp;million and is payable in one installment in the first quarter of 2013 based upon operational performance for the fiscal year ending December&nbsp;31, 2012. At December&nbsp;31, 2011, and the acquisition date, August&nbsp;31, 2011, the key
	assumptions relating to this potential contingent consideration includes earn-out payments for the fiscal year and a probability adjusted level of 60% for the base case and 25% and 15% for the upside and downside scenarios, respectively. Based on
	the forecasts for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2012, the Company valued the contingent consideration at December&nbsp;31, 2011, and the acquisition date at $2.4&nbsp;million. The Company determined that there was no change in the
	assumptions from the date of acquisition to December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-17
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The second potential consideration related to our acquisition of Proxsys in 2011 ranges
	from zero to $5.0&nbsp;million and is payable in quarterly installments based upon the cross selling of the Company&#146;s services into the new and acquired company&#146;s customer base from acquisition to the second year anniversary of the
	acquisition in the third quarter of 2013. On December&nbsp;31, 2011, and the acquisition date, August&nbsp;31, 2011, the key assumptions relating to this potential contingent consideration included earn-out payments, a probability adjusted level of
	65% for the base case and 25% and 10% for the upside and downside scenarios, respectively. The Company valued the contingent consideration at December&nbsp;31, 2011, and the acquisition date at $4.4&nbsp;million. The Company determined that there
	was no change in assumptions from the date of acquisition to December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>

	of financial instruments determined by Level 3 for the years presented, are as follows:

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has no capital leases as of December&nbsp;31, 2011. The gross amount of the Company assets under capital
	leases as of December&nbsp;31, 2010, was $7.3&nbsp;million of equipment, $1.1&nbsp;million of leasehold and building improvements, and $0.3&nbsp;million of furniture.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The fair values of the property and equipment acquired as part of the purchase of the Point Lookout facility are allocated as buildings $4.8&nbsp;million, land and land improvements $2.1 million, and
	furniture and fixtures $0.6&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	8.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	OPERATING LEASES AND OTHER COMMITMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company maintains operating leases for facilities and certain office equipment. The facility leases contain renewal
	options and require payments of certain utilities, taxes, and shared operating costs of each leased facility. The rental agreements expire at various dates from 2012 to 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company entered into a lease agreement with a landlord in connection with the relocation of its corporate offices in June 2005. Under the terms of such lease agreement, the landlord provided
	approximately $11.5&nbsp;million in allowances to the Company for the leasehold improvements for the office space, reimbursement of moving costs and all payments under the Company&#146;s lease agreement relating to its previous office space. Prior
	to May 2011, the incentive payments received from the new landlord were being recognized over the lease term and accounted for as a component of deferred rent on the Company&#146;s Consolidated Balance Sheet. In May 2011, the Company paid
	$2.1&nbsp;million to settle the remaining amounts of these rental incentive loans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-20
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The lease agreement contains certain financial and operational covenants. These
	covenants provide for restrictions on, among other things, a change in control of the Company and certain structural additions to the premises, without prior consent from the landlord. The Company is in compliance with all financial covenants as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Rent expense for the Company totaled $3.5&nbsp;million, $2.9&nbsp;million, and $2.4&nbsp;million for
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010, and 2009, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

	Future minimum lease payments under non-cancelable
	operating leases as of December&nbsp;31, 2011, are as follows:

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2011 Line of Credit
</I>
	&#151; On October&nbsp;20, 2011, the Company entered into a
	$100.0&nbsp;million new revolving credit agreement (&#147;Revolving Credit Agreement&#148;) with a term of five years. The Revolving Credit Agreement replaces the $15.0&nbsp;million Credit Agreement that expired September&nbsp;30, 2011. The terms
	and conditions of the Revolving Credit Agreement are customary to facilities of this nature. The Company was required to pay financing fees of $0.7&nbsp;million for this Revolving Credit Agreement which is being amortized in interest expense in the
	Consolidated Statement of Operations over the five year term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2008 Term and Revolving Loans
</I>
	&nbsp;&#151; On
	September&nbsp;30, 2008, the Company entered into a Credit Agreement (the &#147;Credit Agreement&#148;) with a financial institution. The Credit Agreement consisted of a revolving credit facility in the amount of $15.0&nbsp;million and a term loan
	facility in the amount of $6.0&nbsp;million (collectively, the &#147;Credit Facility&#148;). In May 2011, the Company repaid the outstanding balance of the term loan and the entire Credit Agreement matured on September&nbsp;30, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-21
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D264994D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Capital Lease Obligation &#151;
</I>
	In June 2007, the Company entered into a master
	lease and security agreement (the &#147;Equipment Line&#148;) with a financing company. The Equipment Line allows for the Company to lease from the financing company eligible equipment purchases, submitted within 90&nbsp;days of the applicable
	equipment&#146;s invoice date. Each lease has a 36 month term which are payable in equal monthly installments, commencing on the first day of the fourth month after the date of the disbursements of such loan and continuing on the first day of each
	month thereafter until paid in full. The Company has accounted for these as capital leases. In May 2011 the Company terminated these leases and elected to purchase the assets for approximately $1.0&nbsp;million. The weighted average interest rate
	implicit in the leases was 4.3%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	10.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	STOCKHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Preferred Stock
</I>
	&#151; The Company&#146;s board of directors has the authority, without further action by
	stockholders, to issue up to 5,000&nbsp;shares of preferred stock in one or more series. The Company&#146;s board of directors may designate the rights, preferences, privileges, and restrictions of the preferred stock, including dividend rights,
	conversion rights, voting rights, terms of redemption, liquidation preference, and number of shares constituting any series or the designation of any series. The issuance of preferred stock could have the effect of restricting dividends on the
	Company&#146;s common stock, diluting the voting power of its common stock, impairing the liquidation rights of its common stock, or delaying or preventing a change in control. The ability to issue preferred stock could delay or impede a change in
	control. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, no shares of preferred stock were outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Common
	Stock
</I>
	&nbsp;&#151; Common stockholders are entitled to one vote per share and dividends when declared by the Board of Directors, subject to any preferential rights of preferred stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Warrants
</I>
	&nbsp;&#151; In connection with equipment financing with a finance company and a bank in May 2001, the Company issued
	warrants to purchase shares of the Company&#146;s stock at an exercise price of $3.08 per share. There remains 32 warrants outstanding and are exercisable through September 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2007, the board of directors and the Company&#146;s stockholders approved the 2007 Stock Option and
	Incentive Plan (the &#147;2007 Plan&#148;). The 2007 Plan was amended in 2011 to (i)&nbsp;remove an Evergreen Provision which provided for an annual increase, (ii)&nbsp;increased the number of share reserved for issuance, (iii)&nbsp;set minimum
	restriction periods for stock awards, (iv)&nbsp;set maximum awards payable for performance-based awards, (v)&nbsp;added performance criteria and (vi)&nbsp;other administrative changes. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010, there were approximately
	2,494 and 1,298&nbsp;shares, respectively, available for grant under the Company&#146;s stock award plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-22
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D264994D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Stock Option Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Options granted under the 2007 Plan may be incentive stock options or non-qualified stock options under the applicable provisions of the
	Internal Revenue Code. Incentive stock options are granted with exercise prices at or above the fair value of the Company&#146;s common stock at the grant date as determined by the Board of Directors. Incentive stock options granted to employees who
	own more than 10% of the voting power of all classes of stock are granted with exercise prices at 110% of the fair value of the Company&#146;s common stock at the date of the grant. Non-qualified stock options may be granted with exercise prices up
	to the fair value of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of the grant, as determined by the Board of Directors. All options granted vest over a range of one to four years and have contractual terms of between five and ten years. Options
	granted typically vest 25%&nbsp;per year over a total of four years at each anniversary, with the exception of options granted to members of the board of directors, which vest on a quarterly basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table presents the stock option activity for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	The risk-free interest rate estimate was based on the U.S.&nbsp;Treasury rates for U.S.&nbsp;Treasury
	zero-coupon bonds with maturities similar to those of the expected term of the award being valued. The expected dividend yield was based on the Company&#146;s expectation of not paying dividends in the foreseeable future.

<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D264994D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For grants issued during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2010 and 2009, the expected
	option term reflects the application of the simplified method. The simplified method defines the life as the average of the contractual term of the options and the weighted average vesting period for all option tranches. This methodology was
	utilized due to the short length of time our common stock had been publicly traded. In 2011, the Company began using company-specific historical information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Since the Company completed its initial public offering in September 2007, it does not have sufficient history as a publicly traded company to evaluate its volatility factor. As such, the Company analyzed
	the volatilities of a group of peer companies, including company-specific historical information to date, to support the assumptions used in its calculations. The Company averaged the volatilities of the peer companies with in-the-money options,
	sufficient trading history and similar vesting terms to generate the assumptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and 2010,
	there was $20.8 million and $26.4 million, respectively, of unrecognized stock-based compensation expense related to unvested stock option share-based compensation arrangements granted under the Company&#146;s stock award plans. This expense is
	expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately 2.3 years. The weighted average fair value of stock options granted during fiscal 2011, 2010, and 2009, was $21.01, $19.06, and $14.56, respectively. The intrinsic value of
	shares purchased during fiscal 2011, 2010, and 2009, was $26.1 million, $15.2 million, and $16.5 million, respectively. The intrinsic value is calculated as the difference between the market value on the date of purchase and the exercise price of
	the options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Restricted Stock Units
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The 2007 Plan also allows for granting of restricted stock unit awards under the terms of the plan. Majority of restricted units vest in four equal, annual installments on the anniversaries of the vesting
	start date or in four equal, quarterly installments on anniversaries of the vesting date. The Company estimated the fair value of the restricted stock units using the market price of its common stock on the date of the grant. The fair value of
	restricted stock units is amortized on a straight-line basis over the vesting period. The following table presents the restricted stock unit activity for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, $27.2 million of total unrecognized compensation costs related to
	restricted stock units is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.7 years. This amount does not include the cost of new restricted stock units that may be granted in future periods or any changes in the Company&#146;s
	forfeiture percentage. Stock-based compensation expense of $7.3&nbsp;million, $2.3&nbsp;million and $0 was recorded for restricted stock units during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s 2007 Employee Stock Purchase Plan (&#147;2007 ESPP&#148;) allows employees, officers, and directors to purchase shares of common stock. The purchase price is equal to 85% of the lower
	of the closing price of the Company&#146;s common stock on (1)&nbsp;the first day of the purchase period or (2)&nbsp;the last day of the purchase period. The expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010, and 2009 was $1.0&nbsp;million,
	$0.4&nbsp;million and $0.4&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-24
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company classifies its deferred tax assets and liabilities as current or noncurrent
	based on the classification of the related asset or liability for financial reporting giving rise to the temporary difference. A deferred tax asset that is not related to an asset or liability for financial reporting, including deferred tax assets
	related to net operating loss (&#147;NOLs&#148;) carryforwards, is classified according to the expected reversal date. The Company recorded a valuation allowance against certain state net operating losses related to Anodyne. The Company evaluated
	the ability to utilize the losses and determined they could not&nbsp;meet the more likely than not standard of utilizing the losses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, the Company had federal and state NOLs of approximately $22.7&nbsp;million (which includes $17.0&nbsp;million of NOLs from stock-based compensation) and $6.3&nbsp;million
	(which includes $1.0&nbsp;million of NOLs from stock-based compensation), respectively, to offset future federal and state taxable income. The state NOLs begin to expire 2012 and the federal NOLs expire at various times from 2022 through 2028. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2010, the Company had federal and state NOLs of approximately $37.9&nbsp;million (which includes $31.5&nbsp;million of NOLs from stock-based compensation) and $5.4&nbsp;million (which includes $1.8&nbsp;million of NOLs from
	stock-based compensation), respectively, to offset future federal and state taxable income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company has generated NOLs
	from stock-based compensation deductions in excess of expenses recognized for financial reporting purposes (excess tax benefits). Excess tax benefits are realized when they reduce taxes payable, as determined using a &#147;with and without&#148;
	method, and are credited to additional paid-in capital rather than as a reduction of income tax provision. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010 and 2009, the Company realized excess tax benefits from federal and state tax deductions
	of $14.2&nbsp;million, $9.2&nbsp;million and $2.5&nbsp;million, respectively, which was credited to additional paid-in capital. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, the amount of unrecognized federal and state excess tax benefits is $6.0&nbsp;million and
	$0.1&nbsp;million, respectively, which will be credited to additional paid-in capital when realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	During the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2011, the Company utilized tax federal NOLs to reduce the current tax provision by $0.3&nbsp;million. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2010, the Company utilized tax federal NOLs carryforwards to reduce the current tax
	provision by $4.6&nbsp;million. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, the Company utilized tax federal NOLs carryforwards to reduce the current tax provision by $8.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s federal research and development tax credit carryforward is available to offset future federal and state taxes and
	expire at various times through 2031.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A reconciliation of the federal statutory income tax rate to the Company&#146;s
	effective income tax rate is as follows for the years ended December&nbsp;31:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Included in the balance of unrecognized tax benefits at December&nbsp;31, 2011, are $1.2&nbsp;million of
	tax benefits that, if recognized, would affect the effective tax rate. Included in the 2009 year increases was $1.3&nbsp;million of unrecognized tax benefits which the Company acquired through its acquisition of Anodyne, Inc. The Company does not
	expect unrecognized tax benefits will significantly change within 12 months of the reporting date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company is subject to
	taxation in the United States, various states and India. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, tax years 1997 through 2010 &#151; except for 2006 through 2008 for federal purposes &#151; remain open to examination by major taxing jurisdictions to which the
	Company is subject, which years primarily resulted in carryforward attributes that may still be adjusted upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service or state tax authorities if they have or will be used in a future period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLAN
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company sponsors a 401(k) retirement savings plan (the &#147;401(k) Plan&#148;), under which eligible employees may
	contribute, on a pre-tax basis, specified percentages of their compensation, subject to maximum aggregate annual contributions imposed by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. All employee contributions are allocated to the employee&#146;s individual
	account and are invested in various investment options as directed by the employee. Employees&#146; cash contributions are fully vested and non-forfeitable. The Company may make a discretionary contribution in any year, subject to authorization by
	the Company&#146;s Board of Directors. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, 2010, and 2009, the Company&#146;s contributions to the Plan were $1.7&nbsp;million, $1.2&nbsp;million, and $0.9&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company is engaged from time to time in certain legal disputes arising in the ordinary course of business,
	including employment discrimination claims and challenges to the Company&#146;s intellectual property. The Company believes that it has adequate legal defenses and believes that it is remote that the ultimate dispositions of these actions will have
	a material effect on the Company&#146;s financial position, results of operations, or cash flows. There are no accruals for such claims recorded at December&nbsp;31, 2011.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s services are subject to sales and use taxes in certain jurisdictions. The Company&#146;s contractual agreements with its customers provide that payment of any sales or use tax
	assessments are the responsibility of the customer. Accordingly, the Company believes that sales and use tax assessments, if applicable, will not have a material effect on the Company&#146;s financial position, results of operations, or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-27
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage102"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D264994D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Prompt Medical Systems, L.P.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On March&nbsp;2, 2010, a complaint was filed by Prompt Medical Systems, L.P. naming the Company and several other defendants in a patent
	infringement case (
<I>
	Prompt Medical Systems, L.P. v. AllscriptsMisys Healthcare Solutions, Inc. et al.
</I>
	, Civil Action No.&nbsp;6:2010cv00071, United States District Court for the Eastern District of Texas). The complaint alleges that the Company
	has infringed U.S. Patent No.&nbsp;5,483,443 with a listed issue date of January&nbsp;9, 1996, entitled &#147;Method for Computing Current Procedural Terminology Codes from Physician Generated Documentation.&#148; The complaint seeks an injunction
	enjoining infringement, damages, and pre- and post-judgment costs and interest. The Company and several other defendants filed motions to dismiss the complaint. On February&nbsp;11, 2011, the Court issued an order granting-in-part and
	denying-in-part the motions to dismiss. The Court ordered the plaintiff to replead certain claims within fourteen days of the order.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On February&nbsp;23, 2011, the plaintiff filed its amended complaint in response to the Court&#146;s February&nbsp;11, 2011, order. The Company filed its answer to the amended complaint on March&nbsp;9,
	2011, denying all allegations of patent infringement, asserting a number of defenses and counterclaiming for a declaration of non-infringement, invalidity, and unenforceability. The Company also filed a joint motion with other defendants seeking
	sanctions for the plaintiff&#146;s spoliation of evidence, which is now fully briefed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;24, 2010, several
	defendants filed (i)&nbsp;a motion for summary judgment of invalidity against the patent-in-suit on the basis that it claims only non-patentable subject matter and (ii)&nbsp;a motion to stay all proceedings pending the resolution of the motion for
	summary judgment. The Company filed a motion to join in the motion to stay the proceedings. On September 30, 2011, the Court denied defendant&#146;s motion to stay all proceedings pending the resolution of the motion for summary judgment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A claim construction hearing was held on November&nbsp;10, 2011. The Court also heard arguments on defendants&#146; motion
	for summary judgment of invalidity after the claim construction hearing. The Court issued its claim construction order on December 15, 2011. The case is currently in the discovery phase, which was set to close on February 10, 2012. Trial was
	scheduled for June 11, 2012. On December 28, 2011, the Court granted a joint motion between plaintiff, the Company, and other defendants, to stay the case pending settlement, instructing the parties to file a stipulation of dismissal after execution
	of the settlement agreement. Settlement discussions are ongoing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The Company is being indemnified in this lawsuit from and
	against any liability, pursuant to a license agreement with one of its vendors. That vendor is also providing the Company&#146;s defense. The Company believes that it has meritorious defenses to the lawsuit and continues to contest it vigorously.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	PPS Data, LLC
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On July&nbsp;28, 2011, a complaint was filed by PPS Data, LLC naming the Company in a patent infringement case (
<I>
	PPS Data, LLC v. athenahealth, Inc.
</I>
	, Civil Action No.&nbsp;3:11-cv-00746, United
	States District Court for the Middle District of Florida). The complaint alleges that the Company has infringed U.S. Patent No.&nbsp;6,343,271 with a listed issue date of January&nbsp;29, 2002, entitled &#147;Electronic Creation, Submission,
	Adjudication, and Payment of Health Insurance Claims&#148; (the &#147;271 Patent&#148;). The complaint seeks an injunction enjoining infringement, damages, pre- and post-judgment costs and interest, and attorneys&#146; fees. On September&nbsp;8,
	2011, the Company filed a motion to dismiss, or, in the alternative, a motion for summary judgment. On October&nbsp;18, 2011, the plaintiff filed a motion for leave to amend its complaint to allege that the Company has infringed on U.S. Patent
	No.&nbsp;6,341,265 with a listed issue date of January&nbsp;22, 2002, entitled &#147;Provider claim editing and settlement system,&#148; and U.S. Patent No.&nbsp;7,194,416 with a listed issue date of March&nbsp;20, 2007, entitled &#147;Interactive
	creation and adjudication of health care insurance claims.&#148; The Court granted the plaintiff&#146;s motion for leave to amend its complaint on December&nbsp;21, 2011, and on December&nbsp;23, 2011, the plaintiff filed its amended complaint. On
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-28
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage103"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D264994D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	athenahealth, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	NOTES&nbsp;TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	(Amounts in tables in thousands, except per-share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	December&nbsp;27, 2011, the Company filed a motion to dismiss, or, in the alternative, a motion for summary judgment of non-infringement with respect to the &#145;271 Patent. On December&nbsp;29,
	2011, the United States Patent and Trademark Office granted the Company&#146;s request for reexamination of the &#145;271 Patent. On January&nbsp;9, 2012, the Company filed a motion to stay the case pending completion of the patent reexamination.
	The Court has not yet ruled on this motion. The Company believes that it has meritorious defenses to the amended complaint and will continue to contest the claims vigorously.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Medsquire, LLC
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On December&nbsp;7, 2011, a complaint was filed by
	Medsquire, LLC against the Company in a patent infringement case (
<I>
	Medsquire, LLC v. athenahealth, Inc.
</I>
	, Civil Action No.&nbsp;2:11-CV-10126-JHN-PLA, United States District Court for the Central District of California). The complaint alleges
	that the Company has infringed U.S. Patent No.&nbsp;5,682,526 with a listed issue date of October&nbsp;28, 1997, entitled &#147;Method and System for Flexibly Organizing, Recording, and Displaying Medical Patient Care Information Using Fields in a
	Flowsheet.&#148; The complaint seeks damages, pre-judgment interest, and attorneys&#146; fees. The Company believes that it has meritorious defenses to the complaint and will contest the claims vigorously.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	AdvancedMD Software, Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On July&nbsp;18, 2011, the Company filed a complaint against AdvancedMD Software, Inc. in the United States District Court for the District of Massachusetts. The complaint alleges that AdvancedMD
	Software, Inc. has infringed two of the Company&#146;s U.S. Patents: No.&nbsp;7,617,116, which was issued on November&nbsp;10, 2009, for &#147;Practice Management and Billing Automation System&#148; and No.&nbsp;7,720,701, which was issued on
	May&nbsp;18, 2010, for &#147;Automated Configuration of Medical Practice Management Systems.&#148; The Company is seeking permanent injunctive relief, damages, pre- and post-judgment costs and interest, and attorneys&#146; fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Cordjia, LLC
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On July&nbsp;18, 2011, a complaint was filed in the Superior Court for Waldo County, Maine, against the Company entitled
<I>
	Cordjia, LLC v. athenahealth, Inc
</I>
	. The complaint alleges that the Company
	entered into a partnership with the plaintiff to purchase property in Maine, that the parties entered into a mutual non-disclosure agreement governing the sharing of confidential information between them, and that the Company subsequently terminated
	the partnership and purchased the property itself, using the confidential information obtained from the plaintiff to do so. The complaint purports to state claims for common-law fraud, negligent misrepresentation, breach of fiduciary duty, unjust
	enrichment,
<I>
	quantum meruit
</I>
	, promissory estoppel, breach of contract, and violation of the Maine Uniform Trade Secrets Act. The complaint seeks unspecified damages, fees and costs, and injunctive relief enjoining the Company from making
	further use of the plaintiff&#146;s confidential information and requiring the Company to return all confidential information in its possession to the plaintiff. On August&nbsp;8, 2011, the Company filed a motion to dismiss for improper venue. On
	November&nbsp;17, 2011, the Court granted the Company&#146;s motion to dismiss for improper venue as to the claims for unjust enrichment,
<I>
	quantum meruit
</I>
	, breach of contract, and violation of the Maine Uniform Trade Secret Act, and denied the
	Company&#146;s motion as to the other claims. On December&nbsp;19, 2011, the Company filed motions to dismiss the remaining claims.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On December&nbsp;8, 2011, a complaint was filed in the Superior Court for New Castle County, Delaware against the Company entitled
<I>
	Cordjia, LLC v. athenahealth, Inc.
</I>
	The complaint pertains to the
	same facts as stated above and alleges claims for breach of contract, unjust enrichment,
<I>
	quantum meruit
</I>
	, and violation of the Delaware Uniform Trade Secrets Act. The complaint seeks unspecified damages, fees and costs, an injunction enjoining
	the Company from making any further use of the confidential information, and an order requiring the Company to return any copies of confidential information. On February&nbsp;2, 2012, the Company filed a motion to dismiss the complaint.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	F-29
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Kickapoo Run, LLC
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	On September&nbsp;16, 2011, a complaint was filed by Kickapoo Run, LLC naming the Company and several other defendants in a patent
	infringement case (
<I>
	Kickapoo Run, LLC v. athenahealth, Inc. et al.
</I>
	, Civil Action No.&nbsp;1:99-mc-09999, United States District Court for the District of Delaware). The complaint alleges that the Company has infringed U.S. Patent
	No.&nbsp;5,961,332 with a listed issue date of October&nbsp;5, 1999, entitled &#147;Apparatus for Processing Psychological Data and Method of Use Thereof.&#148; The complaint seeks an injunction enjoining infringement, damages, costs, expenses, pre-
	and post-judgment interest, and attorneys&#146; fees. The Company believes that it has meritorious defenses to the complaint and will contest the claims vigorously.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition, from time to time the Company may be subject to other legal proceedings, claims, and litigation arising in the ordinary course of business. The Company does not, however, currently expect
	that the ultimate costs to resolve any pending matter will have a material effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position, results of operations, or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	BACKGROUND:
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Tenant desires to expand the Existing Premises, and Landlord has agreed to such expansion upon the terms and conditions set forth below, and provided certain other revisions are made to the Lease, all as
	set forth more particularly below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Landlord and Tenant hereby agree as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1.
<B>
<U>
	Expansion Premises
</U>
</B>
	: Landlord will deliver the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises to Tenant as of the Alzheimer&#146;s
	Expansion Premises Commencement Date and Landlord will deliver the A&amp;G Expansion Premises to Tenant as of the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date, and Tenant agrees to accept the Expansion Premises in their AS-IS condition, and Landlord
	shall have no obligation to do any work or make any installation or alterations of any kind to the Expansion Premises, except as follow:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Prior to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date and the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date, as applicable, the Landlord, at its sole cost
	and expense, will, with respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises and the A&amp;G Expansion Premises, respectively, remove (i)&nbsp;all workstations, chairs and office furniture from the premises, and (ii)&nbsp;remove all racks electronic
	equipment (other than lighting and in-wall cabling) and supplementary cooling systems and equipment from &#147;LAN&#148; and data rooms.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All mechanical, electrical, plumbing and ventilation systems (except for supplementary cooling systems and equipment in &#147;LAN&#148; and data rooms) serving the
	Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises and the A&amp;G Expansion Premises, which, under the terms of the Lease, are to be kept and maintained by Landlord, shall be delivered in good working order on the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement
	Date and the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date, as applicable.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	-2-
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage109"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(c)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In the event that the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises or the A&amp;G Expansion Premises are vacant in advance of the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises
	Commencement Date or the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date, as applicable, Landlord shall grant Tenant early access to such premises for purposes of planning, design, demolition and site preparation provided that all such activity will be
	in accordance with all relevant terms and provisions of the Expansion Premises Work Letter attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit C
</U>
	and all other terms and conditions of the Lease.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(d)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	If the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date has not occurred on or prior to September&nbsp;1, 2012, then Tenant shall have the right to terminate this
	Lease with respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises by delivering written notice of termination to Landlord on or prior to September&nbsp;15, 2012. If the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date has not occurred on or prior to
	January&nbsp;1, 2013, then Tenant shall have the right to terminate this Lease with respect to the A&amp;G Expansion Premises by delivering written notice of termination to Landlord on or prior to January&nbsp;15, 2012. As an inducement to Tenant
	entering this Amendment, Landlord agrees that: (A)&nbsp;if the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date does not occur on or prior to May&nbsp;1, 2012, then Landlord shall pay to Tenant one-sixth (1/6)&nbsp;of any amounts actually
	received by Landlord as &#147;holdover rent&#148; (excluding any amounts received by Landlord in respect of any indemnification claims) from the tenant pursuant to that certain Lease by and between Landlord, as landlord, and Alzheimer&#146;s Disease
	and Related Disorders Association, Massachusetts Chapter, Inc., as tenant, dated as of November&nbsp;29, 2004; and (B)&nbsp;if the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date does not occur on or prior to September&nbsp;1, 2012, then Landlord shall
	pay to Tenant one-sixth (1/6)&nbsp;of any amounts actually received by Landlord as &#147;holdover rent&#148; (excluding any amounts received by Landlord in respect of any indemnification claims) from the tenant pursuant to that certain Lease by and
	between Landlord, as landlord, and Allen&nbsp;&amp; Gerritson, Inc., as tenant, dated as of July&nbsp;22, 2003.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2.
<B>
<U>
	Amended Definitions
</U>
</B>
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a) As of the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date the following terms wherever they appear in the Lease shall have the following meanings:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Premises:
</B>
	All references to the Premises shall mean the Existing Premises and the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises. All
	references to Premises after the expiration or termination of the Lease Term with respect to a portion of the Premises shall mean the portion of the Premises for which the Lease Term has not expired or terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Initial Lease Term:
</B>
	With respect to the Original Premises, the period commencing on the Lease Commencement Date and ending on the
	Lease Expiration Date, unless sooner terminated as provided in this Lease. With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises, the period commencing on the First Amendment Expansion Premises Commencement Date and ending on the First Amendment
	Expansion Premises Lease Expiration Date. With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, the period commencing on the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date and ending on the Alzheimer&#146;s Premises Lease Expiration Date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	-3-
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Lease Expiration Date:
</B>
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, or
	such earlier or later date upon which the Lease Term with respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises may expire, be terminated or extended pursuant to any of the conditions or other provisions of this Lease or pursuant to law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Lease Year:
</B>
	With respect to the Original Premises, the period running from the Lease Commencement Date to the first anniversary of
	the Rent Commencement Date and thereafter a Lease Year shall mean the successive year-long period commencing on an anniversary of the Rent Commencement Date. With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises and the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion
	Premises, the period running from the First Amendment Expansion Premises Commencement Date and the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date, as applicable, to June&nbsp;30, 2012 and thereafter a Lease Year shall mean the successive
	year-long period commencing on July&nbsp;1st. Rent shall be prorated for any Lease Year that is shorter or longer than one year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Tenant&#146;s Share of Parking Spaces:
</B>
	425 unreserved parking spaces located in the parking areas of the Complex, to be used in
	accordance with Section&nbsp;2.7.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Basic Rent:
</B>
	Original Premises Basic Rent, First Amendment Expansion Premises Basic
	Rent and Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Basic Rent.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Tenant&#146;s Operating Cost Share:
</B>
	With respect to Original Premises, 100% of Building Operating
	Costs for Building 97 and 29.84% of Building Operating Costs for Building 311 (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Building 311 Premises (112,616)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Building 311
	(377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises, 4.77% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the First Amendment Expansion Premises (18,000)&nbsp;by
	the rentable square feet of the Building 311 (377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, 3.18% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the First
	Amendment Expansion Premises (12,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Building 311 (377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Tenant&#146;s Tax Share:
</B>
	With respect to the Existing Premises, the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 17.98% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Existing
	Premises (133,616)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises, the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 2.42% (the percentage
	calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Expansion Premises (18,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion
	Premises, the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 1.61% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Expansion Premises (12,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting
	quotient by 100).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b) As of the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date the following terms wherever they
	appear in the Lease shall have the following meanings:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Premises:
</B>
	All references to the Premises shall mean the Existing
	Premises, the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises and the A&amp;G Expansion Premises. All references to Premises after the expiration or termination of the Lease Term with respect to a portion of the Premises shall mean the portion of the Premises
	for which the Lease Term has not expired or terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Initial Lease Term:
</B>
	With respect to the Original Premises, the
	period commencing on the Lease Commencement Date and ending on the Lease Expiration Date, unless sooner terminated as provided in this Lease. With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises, the period commencing on the First Amendment
	Expansion Premises
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	-5-
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Commencement Date and ending on the First Amendment Expansion Premises Lease Expiration Date. With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, the period commencing on the
	Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date and ending on the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Lease Expiration Date. With respect to the A&amp;G Expansion Premises, the period commencing on the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement
	Date and ending on the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Lease Expiration Date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	A&amp;G Expansion Premises Lease Expiration Date:
</B>
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, or such earlier or later date upon which the Lease Term with respect to the A&amp;G Expansion Premises may expire, be terminated or extended pursuant to any of the conditions or other provisions of this Lease or pursuant to
	law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Lease Year:
</B>
	With respect to the Original Premises, the period running from the Lease Commencement Date to the
	first anniversary of the Rent Commencement Date and thereafter a Lease Year shall mean the successive year-long period commencing on an anniversary of the Rent Commencement Date. With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises and the
	Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, the period running from the First Amendment Expansion Premises Commencement Date or the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises Commencement Date, as applicable, to June&nbsp;30, 2012 and thereafter a Lease Year
	shall mean the successive year-long period commencing on July&nbsp;1st. With respect to the A&amp;G Expansion Premises, the period running from the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Commencement Date to June&nbsp;30, 2013 and thereafter a Lease Year shall
	mean the successive year-long period commencing on July&nbsp;1st. Rent shall be prorated for any Lease Year that is shorter or longer than one year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Tenant&#146;s Share of Parking Spaces:
</B>
	489 unreserved parking spaces located in the parking areas of the Complex, to be used in accordance with Section&nbsp;2.7.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Basic Rent:
</B>
	Existing Premises Basic Rent, First Amendment Expansion Premises Basic Rent, the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises
	Basic Rent and the A&amp;G Expansion Premises Basic Rent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:13%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Existing Premises Basic Rent: See above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:13%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	First Amendment Expansion Premises Basic Rent: See above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:13%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Tenant&#146;s Operating Cost Share:
</B>
	With respect to Original Premises, 100% of
	Building Operating Costs for Building 97 and 29.84% of Building Operating Costs for Building 311 (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Building 311 Premises (112,616)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Building
	311 (377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises, 4.77% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the First Amendment Expansion Premises
	(18,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Building 311 (377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, 3.18% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square
	feet of the First Amendment Expansion Premises (12,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Building 311 (377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the A&amp;G Expansion Premises, 6.48% (the percentage
	calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the First Amendment Expansion Premises (24,347)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Building 311 (377,340)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:8%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Tenant&#146;s Tax Share:
</B>
	With respect to the Existing Premises, the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 17.98% (the percentage
	calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Existing Premises (133,616)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the First Amendment Expansion Premises,
	the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 2.42% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Expansion Premises (18,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by
	100). With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 1.61% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the Expansion Premises (12,000)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the
	Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100). With respect to the Alzheimer&#146;s Expansion Premises, the Tenant&#146;s Tax Share shall mean 3.28% (the percentage calculated by dividing the rentable square feet of the
	Expansion Premises (24,347)&nbsp;by the rentable square feet of the Complex (743,176)&nbsp;and multiplying the resulting quotient by 100).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	3.
<B>
<U>
	Tenant&#146;s Work
</U>
</B>
	. Tenant shall perform the Tenant&#146;s Work (as defined in the Expansion Premises Work Letter) in accordance with the terms and provisions of the Expansion Premises
	Work Letter attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit C
</U>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	4.
<B>
<U>
	Broker
</U>
</B>
	. Tenant and Landlord each warrants and represents to
	the other that it has not dealt with any broker other than Beal and Company, Inc. and Avison Young, New England (the &#147;
<B>
	Brokers
</B>
	&#148;) in connection with this Amendment. In the event of any brokerage claims against Landlord (excluding
	claims made by the Brokers) or Tenant predicated on prior dealings by the other party hereto with the maker of such claims, the party alleged to have had such prior dealings shall defend, indemnify, and hold the other party harmless against all loss
	and expense incurred by it (including reasonable attorneys&#146; fees). Landlord shall be responsible for any brokerage commission payable to the Brokers pursuant to a separate agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	5.
<B>
<U>
	Ratification
</U>
</B>
	. Except as expressly modified by this Amendment, the Lease shall remain in full force and effect, and as
	further modified by this Amendment, is expressly ratified and confirmed by the parties hereto.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	-7-
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	6.
<B>
<U>
	Miscellaneous
</U>
</B>
	. This Amendment (i)&nbsp;contains the entire agreement with
	respect to the subject matter hereof; (ii)&nbsp;may not be modified or terminated, nor may any provision hereof be waived, orally or in any manner other than by an agreement in writing signed by the parties hereto or their respective successors, and
	assigns; (iii)&nbsp;shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of The Commonwealth of Massachusetts; (iv)&nbsp;may be executed in multiple counterparts, each of which individually shall be deemed an original and all of which
	together shall constitute a single original agreement; and (v)&nbsp;shall inure to the benefit of, and be binding upon, the parties hereto, and their successors, and assigns, subject to the provisions of the Lease regarding assignment and
	subletting. Any termination of the Lease shall also terminate and render void all rights of Tenant under this Amendment. Tenant&#146;s rights under this Amendment may not be severed from the Lease or separately sold, separately assigned, or
	separately transferred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">

<U>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

	LANDLORD:
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
